headline: FLAMEOUT IN THE NORTH
summary: The biggest upset in HoFSN history! The 16-seed Miami Heat shocked the basketball world by defeating the 1-seed Toronto Raptors despite Jayson Tatum averaging 45 PPG in the series (40, 53, 42 points). The Heat won Games 1 and 3 to advance.

matchup: #8 Dallas Mavericks vs #9 New Orleans Pelicans
headline: SKY F***ER RETURNS
summary: Steph Curry put on an absolute clinic, averaging 49.0 PPG in the sweep. He dropped 57 points in Game 1 (accounting for 70% of team offense) and followed with 41 points on 9-11 from three in Game 2. The Pelicans had no answer.

matchup: #5 Sacramento Kings vs #12 Oklahoma City Thunder
headline: Sexton Dominates Closeout
summary: Collin Sexton averaged 33.0 PPG as the Kings swept the Thunder. The Kings shot 66% as a team in Game 1, then Sexton exploded for 41 points on 17-27 shooting in the closeout game.

headline: 13-Seed Upsets Rockets
summary: The 13-seed Brooklyn Nets pulled off a massive upset, winning Games 2 and 3 after dropping Game 1. Damian Lillard led the defensive effort, holding Houston to just 63 points in Game 2 and 64 in Game 3.

matchup: #6 Detroit Pistons vs #11 New York Knicks
headline: Pistons Sweep in Blowouts
summary: The Pistons dominated the Knicks in two blowout victories to advance to the second round.

matchup: #3 Atlanta Hawks vs #14 Portland Trail Blazers
headline: Hawks Offense Clicks
summary: Trae Young and the Hawks swept the Trail Blazers. Young had 33 points in the closeout game as Atlanta's offense found its rhythm.

headline: Wizards Demolish Celtics
summary: The Wizards put on a historic defensive clinic, winning by an average margin of +43 points. They won 119-86 in Game 1 and 130-77 in Game 2, with Jalen Suggs scoring 39 points on 16-20 shooting in the closeout.

matchup: #7 San Antonio Spurs vs #10 Orlando Magic
headline: Spurs Sweep in Tight Games
summary: The Spurs swept the Magic in two close games. Giannis Antetokounmpo led the way with 24 points and 5 rebounds in the closeout despite Anthony Edwards' 40-point effort in Game 1.

matchup: #2 Washington Wizards vs #7 San Antonio Spurs
headline: WIZARDS STIFLE SPURS IN DOMINANT GAME 1 ROUT
summary: The Washington Wizards continued their postseason dominance with a 90-61 victory over the San Antonio Spurs to take a 1-0 series lead. Washington's suffocating defense forced 20 turnovers and held the Spurs to just 61 points. On offense, the Wizards were efficient (59% FG), led by Josh Giddey (22 pts, 9-10 FG) and Jalen Suggs (20 pts, 8 ast). The Spurs struggled to find a rhythm, with Austin Reaves shooting just 4-of-17 from the field.

headline: CURRY DOMINATES AS MAVS TAKE 2-0 SERIES LEAD
summary: The Dallas Mavericks are one win away from the Conference Finals after taking a commanding 2-0 series lead over the Miami Heat. Steph Curry has been unstoppable, averaging 43.5 PPG through two games. In Game 2, despite shooting just 2-of-9 from three, Curry poured in 38 points on 18-of-34 shooting to lead all scorers. The Mavs' offense was relentless, shooting 60% from the field. Miami got solid contributions from Wemby (23 pts) and Haliburton (22 pts), but they couldn't keep pace with Dallas down the stretch. The 16-seed Cinderella Heat face elimination in Game 3.

headline: THE MIRACLE IN MOTOR CITY!
summary: One of the greatest comebacks in playoff history! The Pistons reversed swept the Hawks from 0-2 down, winning three straight games. Zach LaVine was heroic throughout. Game 5 had technical drama (game crashed in 3rd Q with Pistons +8, replayed final 2 quarters).

headline: Defensive Battle
summary: A defensive slugfest between two upset-minded teams. The series is tied 1-1 with the Kings winning Game 2 behind De'Aaron Fox's 26 points and 6 steals.
